website_summaries.verdict: Made for the power-hungry user, as it features 12 processing threads and is ready for overclocking.
pros: Works nicely for gaming by supporting 100-frames-per-second graphics performance
With a six-core design, it’s perfect for software that requires multiple processing threads
Reasonable price point for a popular and powerful processor
cons: Seems to run hotter than we’d like to see, so your cooling system needs to be top notch

customer_reviews.title: Best $200 CPU on the Market
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. I Upgraded from a 1500x and what a difference. It's on par with 2700x and won't be surprise if it not better, when motherboard company releases better drivers later on
customer_reviews.author: Freddie Mac

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU, works with MSI B450
customer_reviews.text: After flashing the BIOS of my MSI B450 Gaming Plus, the R5 3600 was recognized and I booted right into Windows. Upgrading from an Intel i5-7600k, I have 3 times the number of threads to work with and almost no difference in IPC, all with about 10W lower power consumption. Going to use in my virtualization server and make an 8 thread gaming vm and use the other 4 for network things. Overall, what an awesome chip!
customer_reviews.author: rasa123

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty fast for $200
customer_reviews.text: Upgrading from a 1500x and the results were pretty good. Precision Boost Overdrive is way better than with my 1500x and stabler than my 1500x. When gaming, it tends to stay in the 60 fps range (mainly due to the fact I am limited to a 60 Hz monitor without freesync) and tends to stay at 60 fps, even with my RX 480. Installation is easy, so long as you have updated your B350/450 or whatever X370/470 board you have. Just remember to reset your bios completely before inserting the CPU in. :)
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer#5545

customer_reviews.title: very good for its price and performance
customer_reviews.text: this processor is amazing, although I running it with a msi b350 mbo, it is a beast. My perfect combination for price performance.. Ryzen 5 3600 + Rx 580 (Gb) most of esports at 144 hz. I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Best Gaming CPU for $200 hands down
customer_reviews.text: Awesome CPU and heat sink combo. I have it paired with a B450 Tomahawk (make sure BIOS is flashed before you swap cards) and a 2070 Super. It performs flawlessly with absolutely zero lag at Ultra settings on World if Warcraft and Overwatch. I would like to hit the advertised boost clock as I peak around 4.125ghz but I heard they have a fix for it now. Nonetheless, I don’t even need the 4.2 for my needs. If you’re looking for a somewhat future proof CPU at a reasonable price look no further. I switched out the Wraith Spire with a AIO Corsair H100i Pro Liquid Cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Geringer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome performance!
customer_reviews.text: This CPU is the new king of the CPU Universe. Price / performance cannot be topped in gaming, productivity, and casual PC usage... Intel needs to step it up so AMD can continue to trounce them, and we all win as consumers in the end. EDIT: Just changing the voltage to +0.26 in the BIOS, I can run this stable at 4.25GHz on ALL CORES and it stays at full load under 80 degrees (with a dual 120mm fan AIO) . I am very happy with this CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Techtesting

customer_reviews.title: Very hot, Too and not stable
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the Ryzen 1700 and 2600x. Both amazing CPU and they clock and work well. This on the other hand is very hot and temps are quite concerning. My majors issues are the temps under any stress test. I have reseated the cooler 3 times. The lowest temps were 84'c and clock speeds were 3810mhz. The cpu never hits 4.2ghz on any core. The idle voltage is very high. I reinstalled windows, updated the bios and installed the newest chipset drivers.
customer_reviews.author: OB

customer_reviews.title: This is not worth upgrading from 2600.
customer_reviews.text: I used to have my 2600 with the stock cooler running just fine until i got this 3600. First thing I noticed was how it ran with an open case almost 90c°. Closed my case and it runs at 95°c with stock cooler. I had to buy a 120mm water cooler fan to be able to run this cpu around 60°c. The 2600 stock doing 3.8ghz and the 3600 with stock cooler is the same as the 2600. You will need to water cool this cpu if you want it to run faster than the 3600. Very dissatisfied with everything I went through with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Hansser D. Familia

customer_reviews.title: No cpu
customer_reviews.text: The cpu did not come in the box. Only the fan
customer_reviews.author: miran park

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as described!
customer_reviews.text: Truly an awesome beast of a processor that doesn't bottleneck my GTX 1080 and easily rivals top class gaming processors like the 8700K and 9700K and beats the 9600k in a number scenarios and practically destroys first and second gen Ryzen. This was an absolutely great buy. I definitely had to upgrade the cooler though as it's not bad [certainly better than intel coolers] but isn't all that great. Overall excellent price to performance product!!
customer_reviews.author: TechlovingMoses

customer_reviews.title: Long time Intel customer, but love this CPU from AMD
customer_reviews.text: This processor is amazing and I was skeptical of AMD CPU's but after some coworkers suggestions I decided to go with AMD. It was a crazy value when I bought it and was on sale for around the price of the Ryzen 3 I can have my games running in a window while keeping chat windows up with out any stutter. I have not yet overclocked this processor but so far I have not really felt the need to.
customer_reviews.author: TheBlueGrassCat

customer_reviews.title: budget beast!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortably outperforms the i5 9600k at 200$ , very close to i7 9700k performance. recommend this chip for budget builders
customer_reviews.author: Gio

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect to get your XBOX pass
customer_reviews.text: Been getting the run around by several people at Amazon refusing to help get my XBOX code for this purchase, I suggest ordering this from somehwere other than Amazon if you are expecting to also get the xbox code with your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cerquoni

customer_reviews.title: The best value for money CPU you can buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using an AMD processor and I was scared to flop my build, but when they launched the Ryzen series I was skeptical they moved to the next level. I did a lot of research comparing between Intel's i5 9600k and AMD's Ryzen 5 3600 and all reviews praised the AMD Ryzen 5 3600, plus being cheaper than Intel's offering. And they offer a fan included in the box! I did the best investment with this CPU it's super fast and it's not that hot (47 C° on standby and up to 62 C° when working hard with the included fan) I am very pleased with the product, AMD got themselves a new fan.
customer_reviews.author: Armando Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect combination of budget and performance
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up to replace my aging i5-4690K, and it's great. Installed in an Asus Prime X570-P with 16 gigs of GSkill DDR4-3600 (16 more arriving tomorrow) and a Corsair MP600 1TB PCIe 4.0 SSD. Moved my RTX 2080 from my previous build over, and it's been a fantastic upgrade. Gaming is faster and smoother, daily activities are hassle-free (as they should be), and it OC'd to 4.2GHz with zero effort on the stock cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle Mackey

customer_reviews.title: No longer the best budget CPU, but still a great all rounder
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a few months now, and now that the 3100 and 3300X are out, if you're doing just games, those 2 CPUs are much better options considering their price, and a better budget all-rounder CPU would be the 1600AF or a really cheap 2600. However, having 6 cores and 12 threads really make video editing a better experience, on top of having the huge IPC bump compared to Zen+ (I've used a 2600 on a different setup) really makes a difference in games. The 3600 isn't really the "when in doubt buy this" CPU anymore IMHO, but as someone who edits code and videos and games on the side, it's still the best general-purpose CPU for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ovaltine Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: pins are bent.
customer_reviews.text: I got a cpu last week. I checked the cpu to assemble the computer today, and the pins are bent. Very disappointing. I am using it after repairing it, but I feel very bad.
customer_reviews.author: Park,JeongKwang

customer_reviews.title: It should have come with a better CPU cooler
customer_reviews.text: The Wraith Stealth is barely adequate enough to keep a non-overclocked Ryzen 5 3600 within comfortable temperatures when under a load for a long time, such as a long gaming session. There are many articles, blogs, and videos about this issue. AMD should have included the Spire cooler instead at the very least. I have since purchased a much better CPU cooler and hope to see a dramatic improvement. The CPU itself is otherwise great and I expect to use it for a long time before I need to consider upgrading again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M. Howard

customer_reviews.title: 92C out of the box with adequate case-flow.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not entirely sure how this was passed by AMD R&D, but I am beginning to understand why the CPU is being discounted. Out of the box and installed with the stock cooler, I managed to hit 92 degrees after less than a minute into bringing the usage to 100% during a stress test - no overclock. With two intake and two exhaust fans, case flow was perfectly adequate. This should not happen. Those temps should be no where near thermal throttling range after less than a minute or full load. Considering the absolute max is 95C, this is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas W.

customer_reviews.title: The box arrived already opened and the CPU was covered in smeared on thermal paste.
customer_reviews.text: The CPU was clearly a repackaged return with absolutely no care taken to confirm that the part was cleared for resale. To add insult to injury the CPU was listed as brand new/unopened. Currently waiting on the arrival of a x570 motherboard to validate weather or not the CPU is even functional. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Audelo

customer_reviews.title: Great, but had a problem
customer_reviews.text: I have it up and running well, but when I opened the box I discovered there were two pieces of plastic on the thermal paste (not the plastic case around it, I mean there were two pieces on the thermal paste itself). I got the pieces off with minimal disruption of the thermal paste, but I will be monitoring temps closely for the next couple of days. Phenomenal performance, but disappointed with how it was handled before it got to me.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: So far so good with the new 3000 series. Built into a new system with a B450 Tomahawk and VEGA 56 and no issues to date. If starting from scratch, make sure your MB is updated to support Ryzen 3 out of the box or is able to flash the correct bios without a functional processor. Looking forward to seeing how this continues to handle future gaming and blender loads.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic gaming choice
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly fast CPU for only $200. Doesnt bottleneck my RTX 2060. Best value CPU in the world, for sure. Temps are amazig too, I’m using the stock cooler and usually stay in the 50s and very low 60s while gaming at unlimited FPS!
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Lime

customer_reviews.title: Good performance and new techology
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, good performance, but seems to run hot. The processor cooler works ok, but the processor seems to throttle at 92C with this stock cooler. Even though AMD does not publish a max temperature this one reduces power at 92.3C as reported by HWinfo and Core Temp. One day I will probably install the 240mm AIO I used with a FX8370 to see if that keeps it from slowing down. It consistently gets 18,500 CPU Marks with Performance Test 10, but slows down when under constant load with other benchmarking programs.
customer_reviews.author: K Guillory

customer_reviews.title: Best Value without sacrificing a thing hands down.
customer_reviews.text: Fast! Upgraded my old 3570k system to this. Almost went with a 2600 or 2700x, but a friend told me a long time ago it never pays to invest in old tech, and his words have never steared me wrong. I don't care about benchmarks, I care about real world performance, and this runs all my games, and Photoshop without a problem. No hickups anywhere. No stuttering. Everything just runs smooth now. My current system is as follows Asus X470 Strix gaming-f motherboard GSkill Ripjaws V 3600 ram Gigabyte Gtx 1660 OC Again everything just works as it should which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Porkchop

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang For The Buck Gaming CPU!!
customer_reviews.text: If youre looking for a cpu to game on and on a budeget you cant beat this cpu. Its up to par with intels 490$ I9 9900k in single threaded performance. It also comes with stock cooler that works great because there is no need to overclock this cpu as it runs at max out of the box!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nadhir ELADA

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a video editing set up, and it works for what I want it to do. I've done some gaming with it, and it seems to handle anything I throw at it, but a lot of that has to do with the GPU as well. I didn't have any issues at. The only downside is the fan is a bit loud. It's the loudest component in my build. I'm looking into switching that out because being quiet is important to me. Overall the performance has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Adam L.

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, u get what u pay for
customer_reviews.text: Expected it to perform better than my 7 year old 4core processor. Not a big enough difference. Temperatures are always hot. Bounces back and forth 60-70 while browsing the internet and using photoshop. Just running amazon music app kept temps in the 60s. Idling it can go as low as 40 something. My old processor with stock cooler idled at 30 degrees. Also im angry the price dropped 40 bucks right after i bought mine
customer_reviews.author: David Barker

customer_reviews.title: Solid economical CPU for workstation; Wraith cooler is inadequate.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this CPU to build an engineering CAD workstation. The chip is solid and can take everything I throw at it. However, I had some issues when I started it up - I was experiencing random shutdowns and stalls when doing heavy graphics oriented tasks. I discovered that the CPU was overheating and shutting the computer down. it turns out that the Wraith cooler that comes with the chip is inadequate to keeping the chip cool. I replaced it with an aftermarket cooler (Coolermaster Hyper 212) and the problem went away. I recommend this if you plan to use any of the Ryzen chips. Aftermarket coolers are relatively cheap and work much better than the supplied one.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Beast Mode with some work
customer_reviews.text: So... It took some tweaking and a long boot to get my 3600 to run on my X370 mobo. BUT, i went from a Cinebence R20 score with my R5 1600x non-oc of 2511 to a score of 3450 with my non-oc R5 3600. RAM speed was the same both times at 2933 as my mobo refuses to boot at 3200. AMD and all of the mobo manufactures need to update the current BIOS for most boards to streamline the Zen2 processes but I won't hold that against the processor. For $200 bucks this thing is a steal! I do recommend buying a better heat solution or an AIO.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Eherenman

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to get a aftermarket cooler.
customer_reviews.text: Unless you disable the turbo boost on this cpu on idle the cpu temps stay at 55 and randomly spiking to 65. With turbo boost disabled stays at 47 degreeses celuis. Not sure what amd means by high performance cooler included. When the cpu is under full load stays at 85 degreese celuis and spiking to 93 degrees celuis but at $172 its still a good deal the cpu is amazing just make sure to get a decent 3rd party cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Zaker

customer_reviews.title: Could use a better stock fan, but otherwise tough to beat for the price
customer_reviews.text: Overall the CPU represents a great value for the money, but if you're doing heavy gaming I would highly recommend a better fan than what comes stock with this one. I've paired this CPU with the upgraded Wraith Prism which I believe is the one that comes w/ the better Ryzen 7's and the 9's, and I've OC'd to 4.2 GHz with heavy gaming still running in the 65C temp range, no water cooling or even high fan RPM's needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: Great update
customer_reviews.text: I updated from R3-1200 to R5-3600. Gave the expected boost. Old memory was not compatible.... PC kept rebooting so I had to update memory. I probably should have started from motherboard up with a large update like I did. Still provided the boost in throughput/capacity that I wanted. If you've ever installed a cpu, the pins are V E R Y fragile so use extreme care. Watch some videos. The cooler is "OK" for this CPU, but you can do better. If you are gaming and constantly stressing the CPU I would recommend a different cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Homer

customer_reviews.title: Good mid range performance
customer_reviews.text: Fast as heck Stable under full load 12 cores, 24 threads means smooth, fast perfomance even with a ton of software running My cpu peaks around 4.35ghz across all cores Under heavy load for extended duration the cpu's maximum temp is ~60c While I didnt use the fan included with the CPU, it is itself an amazing cooling unit
customer_reviews.author: Only Three Cents

customer_reviews.title: Budget king
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the R5 3600 for $160 ($169 after tax). This was used as a replacement for my younger brothers Threadripper 1920x. The R5 3600 demolishes the 1920x when it comes to gaming. FPS difference in CS:GO is roughly 100 FPS. ~250 on the 1920x, and ~350 on the 3600. The system has 32GB DDR4 3000 MHz ram (overclocked to 3200MHz on the R5 3600 due to better ram compatibility), and a GTX 1080 Ti with a morpheus II GPU cooler. Your results will vary depending on your hardware. Most games, and tasks feel much smoother/snappier. Overall the 3600 is easily the best bang for your buck CPU out currently.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CPU- HOT
customer_reviews.text: This CPU is amazing. Everything I thought it would be, miles better than the 2600. But it does run HOT. I think this thang averaged like 75 C until I got a NOCTUA on it. I would highly suggest investing in a good cooling fan (NOT AIO!) and it took temps down 10C. I have no idea why HANDBRAKE would max out my CPU to 95C but it did. lol, eventually I switched up to a 3700x, and I have had zero complaints on anything. Including temps. All in all, great CPU for the price, but if you have the choice to get the 3700x, make the jump!
customer_reviews.author: Virgil

customer_reviews.title: Great performance for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an overclocked I5-4690K @ 4.3Ghz, the benchmarks are not that much higher BUT I like that I don't need to fool around with overclocking to get great results and the heat stays low in my case. Because of the extra cores and threads I get top level benchmarks without killing everything running in the background. I did a backup set transfer, downloaded some files and ran the benchmarks at the same time and had all results around 100%. It couples nicely with my RTX2070, with everything maxed out and background processes running it has silky smooth game response. This is a great CPU for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzman

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: After a ton of research, for my new build, I got the AMD 3600 with a TUF gaming motherboard by ASUS (With WIFI). I paired with the fractal-design Define S2 Tempered Glass. This is by far the best computing value for the money right now for content production and gaming. Seems to be the sweet spot before you start hitting the diminishing returns.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any issues with my 3600. If I run Prime 95 the temperatures are not great, but that's a real torture test and I should put on a better cooler if I want to run that all day (who does that anyway?) It's just a torture test for CPUs. For real world use I've had no problems. It runs my games and cut my compile times way below what my old Intel CPU could do. I thought the price was good and since faster CPUs in the 3000 line share the same socket I can upgrade to a 3900 or something later if I want to without having to change my motherboard. Good value. No issues whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Peridot Antlers

customer_reviews.title: Gaming rig
customer_reviews.text: Paired great with my b450 gigabyte aureus gaming ITC MB and 32gb Corsair vengeance lox 3600mhz memory.. it screams over my current I7 8700. I’ll be using this for a few and later updating to a x570 & a Ryzwm 3990 later when prices drop down more. Until then I have paired it with a EVGA 2080 to super for future builds if the price and performance holds up.
customer_reviews.author: BigBird

customer_reviews.title: Awesome price and performance
customer_reviews.text: Great product it’s cheap rn I would buy I purchased mine at around 171$US and it has nothing but impressed me my first build ever and this thing is a beast able to handle 1080p streaming and gaming at over 80FPS on games like warzone and Shadow of the tomb raider and also can get 240+ FPS on games like valorant and fortnite if paired with a GTX 1660 Super 6gb ddr6
customer_reviews.author: Hayden

customer_reviews.title: OHHH BABY
customer_reviews.text: I dont even know why you're looking at this review... any tech reviewer can already tell you that this CPU is the real deal for gaming and as long as you have the money to fit this into your budget. If you want to spend a little less money, thats totally fine too and i would reccomend 1600 or the new Ryzen 3 CPUs. Cyberpunk 2077 won't know what hit it
customer_reviews.author: Jack Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Video Editing Monster
customer_reviews.text: This CPU is excellent for video editing, gaming and streaming. I edit using Cyberlink Powerdirector and the preview for 1080/60 footage is great. The main bottleneck with editing is most likely going to be unoptimized software that doesn't use the cores enough and keeps the usage too low (mine stays around 30% unless I'm rendering). I've heard Premiere Pro might be better optimized, but I don't use it myself. I play my games at 1080p 60fps max settings with an RX 570, this thing rarely needs to go over 40% usage. Your GPU will bottleneck before this. OBS while streaming PC games bumps my CPU usage maybe 2-3%, super good chip. Overall, extremely great buy and very inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Omari

customer_reviews.title: Burn, Baby Burn
customer_reviews.text: AMD has stepped up in all fields. Performance, value, and... thermals. By far the best CPU I've ever owned and it easily manages to run my daily tasks and games with ease. The exception to the rule is my content creation in Blender. Rendering pushes the CPU to its 95 degree (C) throttle within seconds and the stock cooler just can't keep up. This is the first time I've ever felt that a CPU NEEDED a watercooler, so we'll see how it goes when that arrives. Other than that, I couldn't be happier with the performance for under $200!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Allen

customer_reviews.title: Fast as hell, worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up at a $180 pricetag, simply blown away by the performance thus far. Running games at max paired with a 5700XT and 16GB DDR4 3200MHz RAM at silky smooth 60fps+. This is simply the best gaming cpu on the market right now considering the price to performance ratio. No need for the Ryzen 7 later series unless you're rendering things 24/7. Also, the only difference between this and the 3600x is that the x has a higher base and boost clock, which this one can achieve with manual tuning. There is absolutely no other difference. Just get this and OC it to a 3600x if you really want that extra 200MHz.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: Excelent price/benefit balance, you might consider a cooler upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: Finally excelent performance on six cores below $200, but if you needs it for video processing or heavy routines (workstation tasks), you must consider to change the stock cooler. Wraith Stealth its just fine for regular CPU usage, but its not capable to maintain temps in a safety range if the CPU is working at 100% sustained during 10min, even without overclocking. If you plans to overclock this CPU, definitely you must to upgrade the cooler; any air cooler will be fine for non extreme overclocking. This is not only for AMD Ryzen 5; Intel i5-10400 (excellent option as well) will also require to upgrade the cooler for same reason.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: YOU NEED A GPU WITH IT!!! NO INTEGRATED GRAPHICS!
customer_reviews.text: Paired this with an MSI B450M-PRO-VDH MAX and a GTX 1060 6GB. Works great and plays Destiny at 75 fps on 1440p with no problems. You will want to buy a better heatsink, the stock one is sub-par. Ideal for a mid range-entry level gaming PC. I also purchased the RYZEN 3400G 4 core 8 thread and it did benchmark a bit lower but you dont NEED a GPU if you go that route. Very pleased overall NOTE: if you DO NOT have an external Graphics card, your beautiful PC build will be displaying a lovely black screen. If you dont have a GPU or cant afford one the 3400G is the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: Sirius

customer_reviews.title: Changed My Life
customer_reviews.text: This processor changed my life, made me a better human being, and cured my depression all within 30 minutes of installing it into my build. Seriously though, I upgraded all the components on my PC when I was having issues and couldn't pinpoint where they were stemming from. The CPU was the last piece I replaced in my PC, and it increased my performance by 100%. It was as big, if not a bigger, upgrade than even the GPU. I previously had a Ryzen 5 1400, and this thing blows it out of the water. For $200 the best purchase I've made.
customer_reviews.author: Matt McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Best general use CPU
customer_reviews.text: This CPU performs well enough for most people in most applications. And unless you're pairing this with a graphics card that's more than $500, it's unlikely that most people will need more. If all you do is surf the internet, and you play no games at all, consider a Ryzen 3 3400G instead. If you are gaming and willing to spend more than twice as much, go for a 3900X or an Intel 10900K/KS. If you are doing serious content creation, especially video or other professional work, you may also want to consider another CPU option. For pretty much everyone else, this is about the best balance of performance and price that you can find at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Tracker1

customer_reviews.title: great cpu
customer_reviews.text: love amd products. Does everything I need and doesn't get too hot. Ill never need more than this, its a great midrange cpu. If youre looking for parts to build a high end gaming pc, stop looking at the ryzen 9, you dont need it. This one is built for it, and you won't have a ton of cores idling because you wasted money on a pricier cpu to have "the best one". Not that the 9 is a bad cpu, but you don't need to for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: False advertisement  no xbox game pass
customer_reviews.text: Great processor Amazon scam everybody there is no pass code for Xbox Neither free games You can buy it from best buy o you will get xbox pass
customer_reviews.author: mohamed

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: I got this processors for a budget build and it has blown me away. While it could use a slightly better cooler it never gets too hot and for the price I can’t complain about a thing.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: This CPU is Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This CPU is the absolute best bang for your buck. I installed this in an Asus ROG Strix B450-F Motherboard and am absolutely blown away at how good this processor performs. I'm able to achieve an all-core Overclock of 4.2Ghz only needing 1.2 Volts! And the temps are nice and cool, idles at low 30's and only hit max of 62C running Cinebench R20 on a continuous loop. And this is on air cooling which is very impressive. I would highly recommend this Processor to anyone who is building a new PC or upgrading.
customer_reviews.author: Mike_B622

customer_reviews.title: All I can say is WOW...
customer_reviews.text: After being an Intel fan for the last 10 years, it was a little hard to look at an AMD chip. But, the reviews could not be ignored... So, I did it, and boy am I glad I did! This is profoundly fast! The only negative thing I will say is this – get a better heat sink... The included one lets the CPU get too hot when you’re really beating on the computer...
customer_reviews.author: David S

customer_reviews.title: Easily the best CPU at this price
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. I am a first time PC builder and had 0 issues installing (watch a youtube video and you'll get it right the first time too!) I thought I'd want more out of it but tbh I think I even underutilize it's TRUE potential. Beast of a CPU & an absolute steal. Stock Wraith cooler works well, as quiet as any other component in my build, I'm not sure what noise people are saying they hear when using this cooler but maybe ANY noise is too much? Either way, this CPU/cooler combo work well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chase K.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for getting that Game itch satisfied at a reasonable cost
customer_reviews.text: This AMD performs great for those games that need a CPU to do some number crunching. I put this into a ASUS Prime B550M-A Motherboard with G.Skill RipJaws V Series 16GB DDR4 3600. with a Radeon 5700XT and the games deliver excellent frame rates and great details. I would recommend if your on a budget and want to get a great gaming performance or just doing 3D graphics work. Get this multithreaded CPU to handle all the data crunching you need.
customer_reviews.author: amazon pro

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best performance for your money
customer_reviews.text: Not much to add that isn't covered by the numerous tech sites and YouTube pages that specialize in testing and benchmarking every cpu that is released. I bought this to update a gaming PC for my kid. Tossed it into an MSI B450 Tomahawk Max and enable the boost in the BIOS. Immediately showed up as 4.2GHZ as expected. The cooler that comes with it is adequate. For the motherboard I used you'll need to remove the brackets on the MB and mount the cooler directly to the four holes left behind. The screws are spring loaded and sort of stiff.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang For Your Buck
customer_reviews.text: This processor is hands down so incredible. I've upgraded from an Intel i5-6500 and WOW. I now can play/stream any game I want too! Not to mention, when editing/rendering videos it handles anything I throw at it like a champ. I've got her running steady a 4.2 and I'm in love <3 Might never look back. Sorry Intel. <3
customer_reviews.author: Tim Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Amazing CPU for an awesome price!
customer_reviews.text: Have this installed in a ASUS Crosshair Hero VIII and works great! Currently have it OC'd using AMD Ryzen Master program with the PBO option which boosts to 3.9GHz. Although you can manually adjust setting to get up to 4.2GHz. I would highly recommend this CPU over the 3600x, if you plan to OC.
customer_reviews.author: MochaJojo

customer_reviews.title: The last word in performance
customer_reviews.text: These Ryzen 3000 Cpu's are incredible. Mine doesn't break a sweat in long gaming sessions. Stock cooler; no problems. Just be aware that older Motherboards (B350, X370, B450, X470) may need a BIOS update, which is easy to do. I'm running my CPU on a B350 motherboard and it runs great! If you want bleeding edge performance but don't want to break the bank, look no further!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas C.

customer_reviews.title: Fast but cooling issues
customer_reviews.text: The CPU is fast as they said, and I'm happy with its performance. However, the cooler that came with it isn't good. Firstly with the default fan speed profile, the fan is loud during idle. So loud that it's bothersome. I set my own tuning curve in the BIOS, and the fan has a calming whirring sound during idle. However, the fan revs up at any small action, like opening a browser tab. Sometimes the fan revs up just by typing. I'm not willing to let my CPU run at a higher temperature without the fan kicking in. I'll likely replace the cooler. It would have been better if AMD had not included a cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Yasir Malik

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best $200 processor ever
customer_reviews.text: Just as fast as my older i7 8700k that cost nearly twice as much. It's a great affordable processor that will last for many years and can handle quite expensive GPU's.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Eng

customer_reviews.title: Speedy CPU and At Reasonable Cost
customer_reviews.text: If you search U Tube you will find much data on the Ryzen CPUs. This 3600 is faster than I need, but why not. RYZEN CPUs are highly rated among the Tech Professional Computer Builders and there are many scientific studies by them. While the standard cooler is ok, for about $25 one can buy a much better heat removing cooler. I spent many hours watching comparisons and i am very pleased with my decision and the Ryzen 3600 HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.author: DON P

customer_reviews.title: CPU GREAT! Cooler not so much!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Great speeds and performance! Perfect! WARNING: Please get a cooler with this CPU. The stock cooler it comes with doesn't do too good at keeping temps low even on high fan speed! Also it can kind of be annoying with sound since you can hear a faint buzzing coming from it when the case is closed!
customer_reviews.author: Penkuza

customer_reviews.title: RUNS TOO HOT with STOCK COOLER - must replace! good performance
customer_reviews.text: With provided stock wraith cooler: idle cpu temp is 52-55C in ~20C room. Averages around 75-90C when gaming. With NHU cooler: idle cpu temp: 40-46C in ~20C room. 60-75C when gaming. (Tested within an hour in same room/condition for ~10 minutes gaming/idle) The stock cooler could be replaced with a better one for better temperatures. Replace for better thermal paste too. Personally bought NHU-U12S 120mm cooler for AM4 board in a phantom p300a case for $60.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Get a different heatsink!
customer_reviews.text: Great value cpu here, I love it Cons - the original heatsink and fan, I recommend getting the cooler master hyper 212 evo I did not buy this originally with my system. When I went to remove the original heatsink it ripped the cpu out of the mobo and bent a pin. I fixed it, it works, but the default thermal paste on it is like super glue. I had to take a razor blade and lots of force to separate them. I thought for sure my cpu or mobo was ruined, thankfully all is well! Be careful!
customer_reviews.author: G. T. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This was for my first pc build and I’m pretty satisfied. It handles multitasking very well and no problems with gaming but that’s more dependent on the gpu honestly. One thing I would say is it was a little neeve wracking to install the included cooler as I had to bear down on the screws so hard I thought the motherboard would crack. That wasn’t enjoyable for a first time build, nevertheless everything has been running smooth and it comes clocking in at 4ghz right out the box so all in all good deal.
customer_reviews.author: mechuy

customer_reviews.title: Beast
customer_reviews.text: Managed to grab this beauty for $160. coming from Xeon 1231v3. xeon was very stable and stays with me in another build. ryzen 5 3600 is just beast. better reaults in Cinebench 20 vs Ryzen 7 1700x. Just disabled PBO. Undevolted -0.05. Core boost On. Q&Q on. Stock cooler is only Con. idle 50-65. Full load 65-85+ celsius. after i got AM4 adapter for my Cryorig H7 how temps are good. idle 40-55. full load max. 73 celsius.
customer_reviews.author: gia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is that this processor has done everything and more for my build. Easy and stable while overclocked, stays cool (I have a full liquid loop) and the future of the AM4 socket will take us all the way into the Ryzen 4000 series CPU's. This processor will take care of 99% of all gamer, streamer, and workflow needs. I have not reached any sort of bottle necking while running FL studio with 50+ plugins running. Amazing CPU
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Best processor for the price.
customer_reviews.text: AMD Has done it again with this one! this cpu is simply brilliant. It can handle rendering youtube videos easily, streams pretty well, and obviously is great for gaming. For the price, it's definitely worth it. I don't know how the stock cooler fares, as I swapped mine out for an aftermarket one.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Hall

customer_reviews.title: Bent Pins
customer_reviews.text: There were a few bent pins that needed to be forcefully straightened. Hopefully this doesn’t hurt my cpu set up when the rest of my parts come in.
customer_reviews.author: fitz judar

customer_reviews.title: Great balance of everything
customer_reviews.text: I built a new PC with this CPU. I can get solid performance in gaming with Fortnite, all other apps run well, browsing works great. Very nice. What is also good is that this CPU consumes only 65W in standard config so no need for a super big power supply or spending a lot of money on fancy cooling. If you want to get more performance out of it, just overclock it and you can no doubt squeeze even more.
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: For my first DIY Build
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep it simple. Out of the box you have everything you need. No thermal paste needed for first install. The cooler that comes with it has a layer of paste on it. This at the time of me getting it , a great price to performance That I could get
customer_reviews.author: The Brinks

customer_reviews.title: Great for a budget build
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my very first personal PC build. Was easy to install and worked with no issues. Looks great for my games compared to anything I used in the past, even if it's not top of the line anymore. Definitely a good choice if you're not doing major streaming or video editing in addition to high-end gaming. I can't review the included fan as I installed a 240 AIO, but I know the blades turned when I hooked it up to test the MOBO/CPU/CPU/RAM before putting everything in the case.
customer_reviews.author: L. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Stock Cooler Fit Issues (Maybe)
customer_reviews.text: Depending on MOBO you go with the stock cooler plastic shroud may collide with MOBO components. There are a number of easy fixes for this (remove shroud, its just cosmetic (I hope)), or change orientation of cooler if power cord allows on your setup. Performance overall noticed a size-able bump in FPS 10-20 because my old i5 4460 was throttling my GTX 980 (itself an old car, but holding up tremendously well). Can almost play BFV and COD MW at the same time!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Biasotti

customer_reviews.title: Glad the price came down
customer_reviews.text: I was going to buy a 2600 for $140 but then the price on this one dropped to $170 so I grabbed it ASAP and it is amazing. I have 16GB RAM and an R9 380 4GD5 so it's a good thing I was already looking into getting an RX 580 (or RX 5500)because almost every game I throw at it is 90-100% GPU at 30-50% CPU, and that's stock clock settings of 3.6Ghz boosting to 4.2, but of course I am going to change soon...
customer_reviews.author: William Dorsey

customer_reviews.title: Great processor for price. Great for gaming and Adobe
customer_reviews.text: I was working with an old 6core AMD processor and it was getting tired. I built up a new machine with this, an Asus b450 board and 32g of memory. The new setup is very fast and will hold me over for a while. I run the stock cooler and the processor at stock speeds and do not notice any heat related issues. I have been running AMD processors since the K2 series, they always seem to be the best value.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Chiarmonte

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU
customer_reviews.text: Delivered everything I hoped. Currently in the family entertainment/theater PC and I don't see any need to upgrade for the foreseeable future. I didn't run any benchmarks or anything, but the thing that impressed me most was loading up some notoriously hard-to-emulate games and seeing them run better than ever. There were some frame drops, but the improvement over my last system (AMD FX-6300) was huge.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good performance for long term use.
customer_reviews.text: I'm realized that recent windows 10 OS/application ask for 4 core or more to use them in stress free. Drawing applications that the my most using ask for AVX2 capability at brash paintings. Ryzen 3xxx series has faster AVX2 capability than 2xxx, and this has 6 cores. Regardless of my usage, background tasks in Windows 10 and some applications will work more anytime, Ryzen 5 3600 will be working in fairly good performance for several years long. AND this was under $150. Nice deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was my first Ryzen cpu and I couldn't be happier with it value and performance. For the money this is very hard to beat. However, I highly highly recommend that you replace the cooler. I didn't overclock and I have very sufficient airflow in my case and I would still reach temperatures of 75 low to 85 high C. A simple 25 dollar aftermarket cooler will drop the temperature 10C or more so do yourself a favor and purchase an aftermarket cooler.
customer_reviews.author: rogue105

customer_reviews.title: 1st AMD CPU. Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install. Got exactly what I wanted. Works great with my B450 motherboard. Would recommend. Great for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon S

customer_reviews.title: The Best Processor For The Money
customer_reviews.text: It already has a million positive reviews and it's well deserved. No issues whatsoever, runs cool and does everything I need it to do. Has 6 cores so I shouldn't need to update for a long time. Wish the cooler had rgb but that's the only complaint. Wouldn't buy any other CPU for under $1000 build. My build was around $750 and I was fine paying a little bit more for 6 cores.
customer_reviews.author: AvatarRoku

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Great cpu for gaming I can’t stress this enough it’s on the budget side but is a beast paired with my 2070 super and trident z neo ram I get COD maxed out at 1440 at 120/144 plus no issues no over heating etc.
customer_reviews.author: Mike poland

customer_reviews.title: Great little overclocker.  Well priced, and plenty of horsepower.
customer_reviews.text: CPU installed easily and powered up in the x570 motherboard I had with no troubles. Wasn't really impressed with the stock cooler (so lost a couple stars on the warmth), however, when a beefier air cooler was added, this thing stayed well below 75C under full load. CPU overclocked with minimal effort, memory overclocked on this to 3600 no problem as well.
customer_reviews.author: Native Idaho Nate

customer_reviews.title: Can't get anything better new for the money
customer_reviews.text: Plays games and does other tasks extremely well. You can't exactly get anything better for the money outside of buying things used and even then the Single Core speed would likely be a bit slower. Runs pretty much every game at 100+ FPS.
customer_reviews.author: FatheredPuma81

customer_reviews.title: RECOMMEND - Incredible performance
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from an i7-3770k and this cpu plus an Asus Strix B550-f gaming Wifi motherboard got me a solid 40 fps increase in WoW. Also provides excellent stream capabilities. I was streaming wow at 1080p with medium settings with a GTX 1060 3gb GPU. And now that I upgraded to a 1080ti Fe Hybrid I stream at max settings at 1080p with 100+fps on Warzone. Lowest my FPS will drop is about 80 with it peaking at 144fps where I set the cap to.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Love this processor
customer_reviews.text: I was torn between AMD and intel. Intel is what I have had in the past and the most common. After doing a lot of research I went with the AMD and I am glad I did! Dollar for dollar this is cheaper and better technology. Yes it is an expensive part but well worth it! There are a lot of motherboards that it fits with which the one I got it sockets in just fine.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: Easily one of the best processors you can get for the money right now. NOT a lot of room to overclock them- But thats not a fault of the processor, and more a credit to AMD for actually fine tuning their product before they give it to you. The ryzen 5 3600 is IMO second only to the Ryzen 3 3300x in regards to "bang for the buck", but the difference is negligible at best, and you can actually get your hands on a R5-3600 right now. Great processor that still punches well above its price tag compared to intels.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: I won the lottery
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to this from the 2600 which was a great decision considering it was on sale when I bought it. I played around with the core and voltage for the cpu and was very surprised I was able to hit 4.3 GHz stable at 1.18v to the cpu. That's the lowest I've ever seen my self and it's stable. Benched it on cinebench r20 and have tried a whole bunch of games and has not crashed at all and stays very cool under my custom water loop. I doubt I'll ever get another chip that overclocks as well as this one in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Mike0179

customer_reviews.title: Was able to achieve 4.2 all core overclock stable
customer_reviews.text: Had to tinker with it a bit but I was able to achieve 4.2 overclock across all cores stable. With just a noctua single tower cooler. It does run a little warm sometimes but pretty much stays around 60C to 65C when using. Though synthetic load would achieve max temp of 95C if not carefully overclocked. But I never see those temps with my workloads and gaming.
customer_reviews.author: wes

customer_reviews.title: I Would Never Buy Intel Again
customer_reviews.text: This CPU series is really awesome. It stays turbo'd constantly on my system and stays nice and cool. This is easily a 5 star CPU for gaming, photo and video editing, and content creation. In my mind the only place this cpu falls short is with after market heat sink installation. I don't love the way that the mounting system is designed for AIO's to clamp onto the two black bars that come included with the AM4 socket motherboard. Other than that, awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Prettyman

customer_reviews.title: First AMD in many years
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that AMD like to make things confusing but a bit of research led me to purchase this CPU. Installation was clean and uneventful. Had a bit of a surprise when I found out it did not have video but I was not planning on using built in video anyway. It pays to read the description. Installed Linux Mint cleanly and as quickly as my poor internet will allow.
customer_reviews.author: Jarion Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Quality CPU
customer_reviews.text: This is the best CPU for gaming and productivity for people on a tight budget. I have used this in my new build and can confirm that it works well. It would be advised to manually undervolt it with the ryzen master utility and set its max speed to 4.2GHz otherwise it will run really hot on the stock cooler. Other than this it is a really good CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Ausatte

customer_reviews.title: Best value for your buck CPU.
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade from the Ryzen 3 for me. I'm so glad I went the AMD route again. The 5 contains so much processing power idk what to do with myself. Before I could barely launch Warzone, or BF5 with discord open. Now? I can do all of that + FL Studio + Just about anything I throw at it at BASE clock. It's kind of ridiculous lol. Thank you for shipping so fast.
customer_reviews.author: SewDough.

customer_reviews.title: Great power for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Only giving a 3 star as my product came with 2 bent pins, I was able to fix myself thankfully as I bought as a replacement due to my previous 2200g dying and was in a hurry to get my system back up and running. Other than that ordeal, this CPU is great, mine runs fine pegged at 4.1ghz, temps with a hyper 212 air cooler stay right around 55 degrees under load. I would 100% recommend, if you get a CPU with a bent pin always try to RMA it right away though, even if you are in a hurry.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary M.

customer_reviews.title: Great cpu .
customer_reviews.text: The Ryzen 5 3600 was a great buy for me . It's a great cpu for Any gaming rigs . I bought a water cooler for it and not using the fan provided but I am sure its a great cooler . I have used this Ryzen 5 to build my second gaming rig and again I have not been let down great speed with a lower power draw . This is a solid cpu and worth every dollar IMO . Thanks AMD
customer_reviews.author: Dubl_A

customer_reviews.title: Great processor but if you plan on doing anything with this cpu buy a different cpu cooler.
customer_reviews.text: The processor is great pretty much sits at 4.0 GHz all the time without any tweaking. The cooler you get has a terrible whine because its sitting at max rpm all the time. Even at max rpm it will let the cpu spike up to 88+C under load. Spend the $20 and buy a DEEPCOOL GAMMAXX 400 and you will be set. With the gammaxx 400 cpu temp doen't get above 65C under load for me. This is a great CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lammi

customer_reviews.title: Best/Cheap CPU for anyone on old Ryzen 1000
customer_reviews.text: Paired it with a b350 motherboard and I gotta say, it works like a champ. It replaced my 1600x and all I had to do was update bios to latest one and pop the old cpu out and pop the new in. If you are going to game go for 3200 ram or faster. Don't buy that cheap Corsair ram, since nobody can run it at 3200mhz. Runs like a champ with stock cooler and can easily oc if Mobo allows it.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Vargas

customer_reviews.title: What a little workhorse
customer_reviews.text: This CPU is pretty amazing , the price was great , it will handle most operations with ease. and if you are into it , it will overclock pretty nicely, although I recommend keeping it stock so it will last longer. It will game very well as long as you have a decent card such as a 580 , granted you cant go ultra on everything but at 1080 and high settings you can get some very good numbers. it can tend to get warm if you do not have a a good cooler. I would highly recommend getting liquid cooler if can afford , or getting a very nice air cooler with 56 cfm or higher.
customer_reviews.author: Boominz28

customer_reviews.title: Ryzen 5 3600
customer_reviews.text: Got it for $200, maybe I should have waited for the zen 3 but I had to build my PC since the pandemic had us on lockdown with a lot of free time. Great value and can’t wait for prices to drop soon!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: AMD Ryzen 5 3600 6-Core, 12-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor with Wraith Stealth Cooler
product_meta.description: AMD CPU 100 100000031box Ryzen 5 3600 6C 12T 4200MHz 36MB 65W AM4 Wraith Stealth.
feature_bullets: The world's most advanced processor in the desktop PC gaming segment
Can deliver ultra-fast 100+ FPS performance in the world's most popular games
6 cores and 12 processing threads bundled with the quiet AMD wraith stealth cooler max temps 95°C
4 2 GHz max boost unlocked for overclocking 35 MB of game cache DDR4 3200 support
For the advanced socket AM4 platform can support PCIe 4 0 on x570 motherboards

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars9,429 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
